description: Number of possible chess games at the end of the n-th ply.
comments: Does not include games which end in fewer than n plies.According to the laws of chess, the "50-move rule" and "draw by 3-fold repetition" do not prevent infinite games because they require an appeal by one of the players, but the "75-move rule" introduced on Jul 01 2014 is automatic and makes chess finite. - _François Labelle_, Mar 30 2015
links: A. Bertilsson, Distributed Perft Project [also found a(11)]
James Grime and Brady Haran, How many chess games are possible?How many chess games are possible? (Numberphile video), 2015.
T. Sillke, number of legal chess positions
Index entries for sequences related to number of chess games
author: _S. J. Edwards_
extensions: a(11) from _François Labelle_, Jul 25 2004, who thanks Joost de Heer for providing computer time
a(12) from _Paul Byrne_ on Oct 24 2006, first verified by _S. J. Edwards_ on Apr 25 2011
